content.description:
A dreamy little line with some big commitment.

 Start as per "Do it for the Thrill" and make the same intro moves to the long flat ledge. Instead of tossing up to crimps off that ledge though, work further left on the ledge and make a hug move left again to a distant crimp. Reach cross-body to another thin crimp, and then to the next jug in the further ledge.

 Cut feet over the deep pit with the creek below you and heel hook way left. Blast up to the rounded lip and find the jug to top out over the left side of the boulder.

 Make sure to build a log landing to help protect the fall as best you can.
content.protection: Log landing, lots of pads, spotters.

content.description:
Drop down to the far right corner of the upstream-most end of the boulder under the roof. Match the very lowest rounded jug ledge and heel hook it too.

 Blast up and left to the distant, long flat ledge. Match and move directly up past more crimps to top out on the right side with good holds.
content.protection: Build a log landing. Lots of pads. Spotter.

content.description: A beautiful creek block with a steep roof. Be ready to build a log landing for this one. Without a constructed landing (plenty of downed logs around) the landing is a drop into a craggy pit with the a running through it.
